text: CHAPTER I

text: A MARVELOUS INVENTION
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: I am a hero worshiper; an insatiable devourer of biographies; and I say
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: that no man in all the splendid list ever equaled Edmund Stonewall. You
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: smile because you have never heard his name, for, until now, his
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: biography has not been written. And this is not truly a biography; it is
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: only the story of the crowning event in Stonewall's career.
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: Really it humbles one's pride of race to see how ignorant the world is of
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: its true heroes. Many a man who cuts a great figure in history is, after
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: all, a poor specimen of humanity, slavishly following old ruts, destitute
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: of any real originality, and remarkable only for some exaggeration of the
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: commonplace. But in the case of Edmund Stonewall the world cannot be
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: blamed for its ignorance, because, as I have already said, his story
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: remains to be written, and hitherto it has been guarded as a profound
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: secret.
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: I do not wish to exaggerate; yet I cannot avoid seeming to do so in
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: simply telling the facts. If Stonewall's proceedings had become
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: Matter  of common knowledge the world would have been--I must speak
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: plainly--revolutionized. He held in his hands the means of realizing the
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: wildest dreams of power, wealth, and human mastery over the forces of
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: nature, that any enthusiast ever treasured in his prophetic soul. It was
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: a part of his originality that he never entertained the thought of
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: employing his advantage in any such way. His character was entirely free
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: from the ordinary forms of avidity. He cared nothing for wealth in
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: itself, and as little for fame. All his energies were concentrated upon
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: the attainment of ends which nobody but himself would have regarded as of
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: any practical importance. Thus it happened that, having made an invention
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: which would have put every human industry upon a new footing, and
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: multiplied beyond the limits of calculation the activities and
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: achievements of mankind, this extraordinary person turned his back upon
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: the colossal fortune which he had but to stretch forth his hand and
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: grasp, refused to seize the unlimited power which his genius had laid at
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: his feet, and used his unparalleled discovery for a purpose so eccentric,
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: so wildly unpractical, so utterly beyond the pale of waking life, that to
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: any ordinary man he must have seemed a lunatic lost in an endless dream
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: of bedlam. And to this day I cannot, without a nervous thrill, think how
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: the desire of all the ages, the ideal that has been the loadstar for
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: thousands of philosophers, savants, inventors, prophets, and dreamers,
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: was actually realized upon the earth; and yet of all its fifteen hundred
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: million inhabitants but a single one knew it, possessed it, controlled
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: it--and he would not reveal it, but hoarded and used his knowledge for
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: the accomplishment of the craziest design that ever took shape in a human
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: brain.
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: Now, to be more specific. Of Stonewall's antecedents I know very little.
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: I only know that, in a moderate way, he was wealthy, and that he had no
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: immediate family ties. He was somewhere near thirty years of age, and
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: held the diploma of one of our oldest universities. But he was not, in a
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: general way, sociable, and I never knew him to attend any of the reunions
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: of his former classmates, or to show the slightest interest in any of the
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: events or functions of society, although its doors were open to him
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: through some distant relatives who were widely connected in New York, and
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: who at times tried to draw him into their circle. He would certainly have
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: adorned it, but it had no attraction for him. Nevertheless he was a
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: member of the Olympus Club, where he frequently spent his evenings. But
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: he made very few acquaintances even there, and I believe that except
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: myself, Jack Ashton, Henry Darton, and Will Church, he had no intimates.
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: And we knew him only at the club. There, when he was alone with us, he
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: sometimes partly opened up his mind, and we were charmed by his variety
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: of knowledge and the singularity of his conversation. I shall not
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: disguise the fact that we thought him extremely eccentric, although the
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: idea of anything in the nature of insanity never entered our heads. We
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: knew that he was engaged in recondite researches of a scientific nature,
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: and that he possessed a private laboratory, although none of us had ever
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: entered it. Occasionally he would speak of some new advance of science,
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: throwing a flood of light by his clear expositions upon things of which
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: we should otherwise have remained profoundly ignorant. His imagination
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: flashed like lightning over the subject of his talk, revealing it at the
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: most unexpected angles, and often he roused us to real enthusiasm for
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: things the very names of which we almost forgot amidst the next day's
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: occupations.
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: There was one subject on which he was particularly
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: eloquent--radioactivity; that most strange property of matter whose
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: discovery had been the crowning glory of science in the closing decade of
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: the nineteenth century. None of us really knew anything about it except
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: what Stonewall taught us. If some new incomprehensible announcement
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: appeared in the newspapers we skipped it, being sure that Edmund would
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: make it all clear at the club in the evening. He made us understand, in a
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: dim way, that some vast, tremendous secret lay behind it all. I recall
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: his saying, on one occasion, not long before the blow fell:
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: "Listen to this! Here's Professor Thomson declaring that a single grain
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: of radium contains in its padlocked atoms energy enough to lift a million
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: tons three hundred yards high. Professor Thomson is too modest in his
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: estimates, and he hasn't the ghost of an idea how to get at that energy.
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: Neither has Professor Rutherford, nor Lord Kelvin; _but somebody will get
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: at it, just the same_."
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: He positively thrilled us when he spoke thus, for there was a look in his
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: eyes which seemed to penetrate depths unfathomable to our intelligence.
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: Yet we had not the faintest conception of what was really passing in his
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: mind. If we had understood it, if we had caught a single clear glimpse of
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: the workings of his intellect, we should have been appalled. And if we
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: had known how close we stood to the verge of an abyss of mystery about to
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: be lighted by such a gleam as had never before been emitted from the
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: human spirit, I believe that we would have started from our chairs and
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: fled in dismay.
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: But we understood nothing, except that Edmund was indulging in one of his
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: eccentric dreams, and Jack, in his large, careless, good-natured way
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: broke in with:
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: "Well, Edmund, suppose _you_ could 'get at it,' as you say; what would
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: you do with it?"
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: Stonewall's eyes gleamed for a moment, and then he replied, with a
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: curious emphasis:
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: "I might do what Archimedes dreamed of."
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: None of us happened to remember what it was that Archimedes had dreamed,
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: and the subject was dropped.
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: For a considerable time afterwards we saw nothing of Stonewall. He did
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: not come to the club, and we were beginning to think of looking him up,
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: when one evening, quite unexpectedly, he dropped in, wearing an unusually
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: cheerful expression. We had greatly missed him, and we now greeted him
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: with effusion. His animation impressed us all, and he had no sooner
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: shaken hands than he said, with suppressed excitement in his voice:
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: "Well, I've 'got at it.'"
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: "Got at what?" drawled Jack.
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: "The inter-atomic energy. I've got it under control."
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: "The deuce you have!" said Jack.
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: "Yes, I've arrived where a certain professor dreamed of being when he
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: averred that 'when man knows that every breath of air he draws has
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: contained within itself force enough to drive the workshops of the world
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: he will find out some day, somehow, some way of tapping that energy.' The
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: thing is done, for I've tapped it!"
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: We stared at one another, not knowing what to say, except Jack, who,
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: inspired by the spirit of mischief, drawled out:
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: "Ah, yes, I remember. Well then, Edmund, as I asked you before, what are
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: you going to do with it?"
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: There was not really any thought among us of poking fun at Edmund; we
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: respected and admired him far too much for that; nevertheless, catching
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: the infection of banter from Jack, we united in demanding, in a manner
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: which I can now see must have appeared most provoking:
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: "Why, yes, Edmund, tell us what you are going to do with it."
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: And then Jack added fuel by mockingly, though with perfectly good-natured
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: intention, taking Edmund by the hand and swinging him in front of us
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: with:
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: "Gentlemen, Archimedes junior."
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: Stonewall's eyes flashed and his cheek darkened, but for a moment he said
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: nothing. Presently, with a return of his former affability, he said:
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: "I wish you would come over to the laboratory and let me show you what I
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: am going to do."
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: Of course we instantly assented. Nothing could have pleased us better
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: than this invitation, for we had long been dying to see the inside of
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: Edmund's laboratory. We all got our hats and started out with him. We
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: knew where he lived, occupying a whole house though he was a bachelor,
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: but none of us had ever seen the inside of it, and our curiosity was on
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: the _qui vive_. He led us through a handsome hallway and a rear apartment
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: directly into the back yard, half of which we were surprised to find
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: inclosed and roofed over, forming a huge shanty, like a workshop. Edmund
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: opened the door of the shanty and ushered us in.
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: A remarkable object at once concentrated our attention. In the center of
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: the place was the queerest-looking thing that you can well imagine. I can
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: hardly describe it. It was round and elongated like a boiler, with
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: bulging ends, and seemed to be made of polished steel. Its total length
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: was about eighteen feet, and its width ten feet. Edmund approached it and
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: opened a door in the end, which was wide and high enough for us to enter
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: without stooping or crowding.
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: "Step in, gentlemen," he said, and unhesitatingly we obeyed him, all
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: except Church, who for some unknown reason remained outside, and when we
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: looked for him had disappeared.
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: Edmund turned on a bright light, and we found ourselves in an
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: oblong chamber, beautifully fitted up with polished woodwork, and
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: leather-cushioned seats running round the sides. Many metallic knobs and
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: handles shone on the walls.
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: "Sit down," said Edmund, "and I will tell you what I have got here."
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: He stepped to the door and called again for Church but there was no
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: answer. We concluded that, thinking the thing would be too deep to be
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: interesting, he had gone back to the club. That was not what he had done,
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: as you will learn later, but he never regretted what he did do. Getting
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: no response from Church, Edmund finally sat down with us on one of the
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: leather-covered benches, and began his explanation.
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: "As I was telling you at the club," he said, "I've solved the mystery of
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: the atoms. I'm sure you'll excuse me from explaining my method" (there
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: was a little raillery in his manner), "but at least you can understand
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: the plain statement that I've got unlimited power at my command. These
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: knobs and handles that you see are my keys for turning it on and off, and
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: controlling it as I wish. Mark you, this power comes right out of the
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: heart of what we call matter; the world is chock full of it. We have
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: known that it was there at least ever since radioactivity was discovered,
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: but it looked as though human intelligence would never be able to set it
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: free from its prison. Nevertheless I have not only set it free, but I am
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: able to control it as perfectly as if it were steam from a boiler, or an
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: electric current from a dynamo."
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: Jack, who was as unscientific a person as ever lived, yawned, and Edmund
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: noticed it. But he showed no irritation, merely smiling, and saying, with
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: a wink at me and Henry:
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: "Even this seems to be rather too deep, so perhaps I had better show you,
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: instead of telling you, what I mean. Excuse me a moment."
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: He stepped out of the door, and we remained seated. We heard a noise
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: outside like the opening of a barn door, and immediately Edmund
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: reappeared and closed the door of the chamber in which we were. We
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: watched him with growing curiosity. With a singular smile he pressed a
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: knob on the wall, and instantly we felt that the chamber was rising in
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: the air. It rocked a little like a boat in wavy water. We were startled,
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: of course, but not alarmed.

title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: dumb-bell (which Edmund declared must have been composed of solid iron,
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: so great was its effect on his needles) disappeared, before there came
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: from outside a blaze so fierce that it fairly slapped our lids shut.
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: "A collision!" Edmund exclaimed. "The thing has struck another big
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: meteor, and they are exchanging fiery compliments."
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: He threw himself flat on the floor, and stared out of the peephole. Then
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: he jumped to his feet and gave us another tumble.
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: "They're all about us," he faltered, breathless with exertion; then,
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: having drawn a deep inspiration, he continued: "We're like a boat in a
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: raging freshet, with rocks, tree trunks, and cakes of ice threatening it
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: on all sides. But we'll get out of it. The car obeys its helm as if it
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: appreciated the danger. Why, I got away from that last fellow by setting
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: up atomic reaction against it, as a boatman pushes with his pole."
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: Even in the midst of our terror we could not but admire our leader. His
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: resources seemed boundless, and our confidence in him grew with every
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: escape. While he kept guard at the peepholes we watched for meteors from
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: the windows. We must have come almost within striking distance of a
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: thousand in the course of an hour, but Edmund decided not to diminish
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: our speed, for he said that he could control the car quicker when it was
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: under full headway.
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: So on we rushed, dodging the things like a crow in a flock of pestering
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: jays, and we really enjoyed the excitement. It was more fascinating sport
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: than shooting rapids in a careening skiff, and at last we grew so
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

title: A Columbus of Space

title: A Columbus of Space

title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: After that the time passed quietly. We ate our meals and went to bed and
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: rose as regularly as if we had been at home. In one respect, however,
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: things were very different from what they were on the earth. We had no
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: night! The sun shone continually, although the sky was black and always
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: glittering with stars. None of us needed to be told by our conductor that
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: this was due to the fact that we no longer had the shadow of the earth to
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: make night for us when the sun was behind it. The sun was now never
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: behind the earth, or any other great opaque body, and when we wished to
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: sleep we made an artificial night, for our special use, by closing all
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: the shutters. And there was no atmosphere about us to diffuse the
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: sunlight, and so to hide the stars. We kept count of the days by the aid
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: of a calendar clock; there seemed to be nothing that Edmund had
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: forgotten. And it was a delightful experience, the wonder of which grew
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: upon us hour by hour. It was too marvelous, too incredible, to be
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: believed, and yet--_there we were!_
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: Once the idea suddenly came to me that it was astonishing that we had not
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: long ago perished for lack of oxygen. I understood, of course, from what
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: Edmund had said, that the mysterious machines along the wall absorbed the
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: carbonic acid, but we must be constantly using up the oxygen. When I put
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: my difficulty before Edmund he laughed.
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: "That's the easiest thing of all," he said. "Look here."
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: He threw open a little grating.
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: "In there," he continued, "there's an apparatus which manufactures just
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: enough oxygen to keep the air in good condition. It is supplied with
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: materials to last a month, which will be much longer than this expedition
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: will take."
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: "There you are again," exclaimed Jack. "I was asking you about that when
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: we ran into those pesky meteors. What _is_ this expedition? Where are we
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: "Well," Edmund replied, "since we have become pretty good shipmates, I
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: don't see any objection to telling you. We are going to Venus."
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: "Going to Venus!" we all cried in a breath.
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: "To be sure. Why not? We've got the proper sort of conveyance, haven't
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: we?"
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: There was no denying that. Our conveyance had already brought us some
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: millions of miles out into space; why, indeed, should it not be able to
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: carry us to Venus, or any other planet?
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: "How far is it to Venus?" asked Jack.

author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: "When we quit the earth," Edmund answered, "Venus was rapidly approaching
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: inferior conjunction. You know what that is," addressing me, "it's when
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: the planet comes between the sun and the earth. The distance from the
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: earth is not always the same at such a conjunction, but I figured out
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: that on this occasion, after allowing for the circuit we should have to
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: make, there would be just twenty-seven million miles to travel. At an
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: average speed of twenty miles a second we could do that distance in
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: fifteen days, fourteen and one half hours. But, of course, I had to lose
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: some time going slow through the earth's atmosphere, for otherwise the
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: car would have taken fire, like a meteor, on account of the friction.
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: Then, too, I shall have to slow up on entering the atmosphere of Venus,
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: which appears to be very deep and dense; so, upon the whole, I don't
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: our departure. We've already been out five days, and within eleven more I
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: expect to introduce you to the inhabitants of another world."
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: which took us all aback.

author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: there was somebody at home?"

author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: "Yes, but I hope we shall not have to use them."
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: automatic guns and pistols and even some cutlasses.
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: "Decidedly piratical!" exclaimed the incorrigible Jack. "You'd better
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: that unprogressive earth that you have spurned with your heels, but
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: they'll likely be rather small pumpkins on Venus."
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: "I didn't prepare anything else," Edmund replied, "because, in the first
title: A Columbus of Space

title: A Columbus of Space

title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: only took these as a precaution."
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: "You mean to try moral suasion, I suppose," drawled Jack. "Well, anyhow,
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: I hope they'll be glad to see us, and since it is Venus that we are going
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

title: A Columbus of Space

text: business in that direction."
title: A Columbus of Space

title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

title: A Columbus of Space

title: A Columbus of Space

title: A Columbus of Space

title: A Columbus of Space

title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: but Jack and I were stirred to the bottom of our romantic souls. Henry
title: A Columbus of Space

text: was different. He had no romance in his make-up. He always looked at the
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

title: A Columbus of Space

text: we had at our command the means of owning the earth.
title: A Columbus of Space

title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

title: A Columbus of Space

text: developed the thing. Why, it's folly; pure, beastly folly! Going to
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: Venus! What can you make on Venus?"
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

title: A Columbus of Space

title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: pattern. But cheer up. When we go back, perhaps I'll let you take out a
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: patent, and you can make the billions. For my part, Venus is more
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: interesting to me than all the money you could pile up between the
title: A Columbus of Space

title: A Columbus of Space

text: and straightening with a certain pride which he had, "am I not the
title: A Columbus of Space

title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

title: A Columbus of Space

title: A Columbus of Space

title: A Columbus of Space

title: A Columbus of Space

title: A Columbus of Space

author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

title: A Columbus of Space

title: A Columbus of Space

title: A Columbus of Space

title: A Columbus of Space

author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

title: A Columbus of Space

title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

title: A Columbus of Space

author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

title: A Columbus of Space

title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

title: A Columbus of Space

title: A Columbus of Space

title: A Columbus of Space

title: A Columbus of Space

title: A Columbus of Space

title: A Columbus of Space

text: which had so astonished us on our approach to Venus. But now their
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: appearance was splendid and imposing beyond words. Above them rose an arc
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: of pearly light which grew higher every hour. And with the arc of light
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: rose the flames also. At the same time they seemed to spread to the right
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: and the left, until they were simultaneously visible from both of the
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: side windows of the car. Their colors were wonderful--red, green, purple,
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: orange--all the hues of the prism.
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: "There is the old mystery again," exclaimed Edmund, "and I can no more
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: explain it now than I could when we first saw it on nearing the planet.
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: The arc of light above is natural enough; it's simply the dawn. The sun
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: never rises on this side of Venus, but it will rise for us because we are
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: approaching it, and the light is the first indication that we are getting
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: near enough to the border between day and night for some of the sun's
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: rays to be bent over the horizon by refraction. But those flames! See how
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: steady they are as a whole, and yet how they change color like a slowly
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: turning prism."
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: "Don't, for God's sake, run us into a conflagration," said Jack. "I'm
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: ready to believe anything of this topsy-turvy old planet, and I shouldn't
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: be surprised if the other side is all fire as this one is all frost.  I
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: can stand these hairy beasts, but I'll be hanged if I want to be
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: introduced among salamanders."
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: "That's not real fire," said Edmund. "When we get a little nearer we can
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: see what it is. In the meantime I'll try to think it out."
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: The result of Edmund's meditations, when he announced it to us, an hour
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: later, awoke as much amazement in our minds as anything that had yet
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: occurred. He had been sitting silent in his corner, occasionally taking a
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: glimpse through the peephole, or one of the windows, when suddenly he
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: slapped his thigh, and springing to his feet, exclaimed:
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: "They're mountains of crystal!"
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: "Mountains of crystal!" we echoed.
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: "Nothing else in the world, and I am ashamed not to have foreseen the
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: thing. It's plain enough when you come to think about it. Remember that
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: Venus being a world lying half in the daylight and half in the night, is
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: necessarily as hot on one side as it is cold on the other. All of the
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: clouds and floating vapors are on the day side, where the sunbeams act.
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: The heated air charged with moisture rises over the sunward hemisphere,
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: and flows off above, on all sides, toward the night side, while from the
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: latter cold air flows in beneath to take its place. Along the junction of
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: the two hemispheres the clouds and moisture are condensed by the intense
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: cold, and fall in ceaseless snowstorms. This snow descending for ages has
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: piled up in mountainous masses whose height may be increased in some
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: places by real mountain ranges buried beneath. The atmospheric moisture
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: cannot pass very far into the night hemisphere without being condensed,
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: and so it is all arrested within a ring, or band, extending completely
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: around the planet, and marking the division between perpetual day and
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: perpetual night. The appearance of gigantic flames is produced by the
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: sunbeams striking these mountains of ice and snow from behind and
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: breaking into prismatic fire."
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: We listened to this explanation, so simple and yet so wonderful, with
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: mingled feelings of astonishment and admiration. And then we turned again
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: to regard the phenomenon, which now, with our nearer approach, had become
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: splendid and awful beyond description.
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: In a few minutes Edmund addressed us again. "I foresee now," he said,
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: "considerable trouble for us. There has been a warning of that, too, if I
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: had but heeded it. I've noticed for some time that a wind, getting
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: gradually stronger, has been following us, sometimes dying out and then
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: coming on again stronger than before. It is likely that this wind gets to
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: be a perfect hurricane in the neighborhood of those strange mountains. It
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: is the back suction, caused, as I have already told you, by the rising of
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: the heated air on the sunny side of the planet. It may play the deuce
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: with us when we get into the midst of it. I shall have to be cautious."
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: He immediately reduced the speed to not more than ten miles an hour, and
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: at once we noticed the wind of which he had spoken. It came now in great
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: gusts from behind, rapidly increasing in frequency and fury. Soon it was
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: strong enough to drive the sleds without any pull upon the cable, and
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: sometimes they were forced directly under the car, and even ahead of it,
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: the natives clinging to one another in the utmost terror. Edmund managed
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: to govern the motions of the car for a time, holding it back against the
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: storm, but as he confessed, this was a contingency he had made no
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: provision for, and eventually we became almost as helpless as a ship in a
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: typhoon.
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: "Of course I could cut loose from the sleds and run right out of this,"
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: said Edmund, "but that would never do. I've taken them into my service
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: and I'm bound to look out for them. If there was room for them in the car
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: it would be all right. Let's see. Yes! I've got it. I'll fetch up the
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: sleds and fasten them underneath the car, like baskets to a balloon, and
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: so carry the whole thing. There's plenty of power; it's only room that's
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: wanting."
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: No sooner said than done with Edmund. By this time we were getting into
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: the ice, huge hills of which surrounded us. Edmund dropped the car in the
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: lee of one of these strange hummocks. Here the force of the wind was
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: broken, and the sky directly over us was free from clouds, but a short
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: distance ahead we could see them whirling and tumbling in mighty masses
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: of tumultuous vapor. Lashing the two sleds together we attached them
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: about ten feet below the bottom of the car. Then the natives, who had
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: been unbound, and had stood looking on in utter bewilderment, were
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: securely fastened on the sleds. We entered the car and the power was
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: turned on.
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: "We'll rise straight up," said Edmund, "and as soon as we are out of the
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: wind current we will sail over the mountains and come down on the other
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: side as nice as you please. Strange that I didn't think of carrying the
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: sleds in this way to begin with."
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: It was a beautiful program that Edmund had outlined, and we had complete
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: confidence in our leader's ability to carry it through; but it didn't
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: work as expected. Even his genius had met its match this time.
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: No sooner had we risen out of the protection of the hill of ice than the
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: hurricane caught us. It was a blast of such power and ferocity that in an
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: instant it had the car spinning like a teetotum, and then it shot us
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: ahead, banging the sleds against the car as if they had been tassels. It
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: is a wonder of wonders that the poor creatures on them were not flung
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: off, but fortunately we had taken particular pains with their lashings,
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: and as for knocks, they could stand them like so many bears.
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: In the course of twenty minutes we must have traveled twice as many
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: miles, perfectly helpless to arrest our mad rush because, Edmund said,
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: the atomic reaction partly refused to work, and he could not rise as he
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: had expected to do. We were pitched hither and thither, and were
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: sprawling on the floor more than half the time. The noise was awful, and
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: nobody tried to speak after Edmund had shouted his single communication
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: about the power, which would have filled us with dismay if we had had
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: leisure to think.
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: The shutters were open, and suddenly I saw through one of the windows a
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: sight which I thought must surely be my last. The car had been sweeping
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: through a dense cloud of boiling vapors, and these had without warning
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: split open before my eyes--and there, almost in contact with the car, was
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: a glittering precipice of solid ice, gleaming with wicked blue flashes,
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: and we were rushing upon it as if shot out of a cannon!
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: The next instant came a terrific shock, which I thought must have crushed
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: the car like an eggshell, and down we fell--down and down!

text: CHAPTER VI
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: LOST IN THE CRYSTAL MOUNTAINS
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: If we had seen the danger earlier, and had not been so tumbled about by
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: the pitching of the car, it is possible that Edmund would have prevented
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: the collision, in spite of the partial disablement of his apparatus. The
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: blow against the precipice of ice was not as severe as it had seemed to
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: me, and the car was not smashed; but the fall was terrible! There was
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: only one thing which saved us from destruction. At the base of the mighty
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: cliff against which the wind had hurled the car an immense deposit of
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: snow had collected, and into this we plunged. We were all thrown together
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: in a heap, the car and the sleds being entangled with the wire ropes.
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: Fortunately the stout glass windows were not broken, and after we had
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: struggled to our feet Edmund managed to open the door. Before emerging he
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: bade us put on our furs, but even with them we found the cold outside all
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: but unendurable. Yet the natives paid no attention to it. Not one of them
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: was seriously hurt, although they were firmly attached to the sleds, and
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: unable to undo their fastenings. We set them loose, and then began
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: seriously to examine the situation.
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: Above us towered the vertical precipice disappearing in the whirling
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: clouds, and the wind drove square against it with the roar of Niagara.
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: The air was filled with snow and ice dust, and at intervals we could not
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: see objects three feet away from our noses. Our poor furry companions
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: huddled together, and being of no use to themselves or us, suffered more
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: from the noise, and from the terror inspired by the snow than from any
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: injuries that they had received.
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: "We've got to get out of this mighty quick," shouted Edward. "Hustle now
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: and repair ship."
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: We got to work at once, Juba aiding us a little under Edmund's direction,
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: and soon we had the sleds out of the tangle and properly attached. Then
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: we replaced the natives on their seats, and entered the car. Edmund began
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: to fumble with his apparatus. After some ten minutes' work he said, in an
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: evasive way, that the damage was not serious enough to prevent the
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: working of the car, but I thought I caught an expression of extreme
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: anxiety in his face. Still, his manner indicated that he considered
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: himself master of the situation.
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: "You notice," he said, "that this wind is variable, and there lies our
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: chance. When the blasts weaken, the air springs back from the face of the
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: cliff and then whirls round to the right. I've no doubt that there is a
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: passage in that direction through which the wind finds its way behind
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: this icy mountain, and if we can get there, too, we shall undoubtedly
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: find at least partial shelter. I'm going to take advantage of the first
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: lull."
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: It worked out just as he had predicted. As the wind surged back after a
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: particularly vicious rush against the great blue cliff, we cut loose and
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: went sailing up into it, rushing past the glittering wall so swiftly that
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: it made our heads swim. In two or three minutes we rounded a corner, and
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: then found ourselves in a kind of atmospheric eddy, where the car simply
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: spun round and round, with the sleds whirling below it.
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: "Now for it!" shouted Edmund. "Hang on!"
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: He touched a knob, and instantly we rose with immense speed. We must have
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: shot up a couple of thousand feet, when the wind, coming over the top of
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: the icy barrier we had just flanked, caught us again, and swept us off on
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: a horizontal course. Then, suddenly, the air cleared all round about, as
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: if a magic broom had swept away the clouds. The spectacle that was
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: revealed--but why try to describe it! No language could do it. Yet I must
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: tell you what we saw.
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: We were in the heart of the _Crystal Mountains!_ They towered round us on
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: every side, and stretched away in interminable ranges of shining
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: pinnacles. Such shapes! Such colors! Such flashing and blazing of
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: gigantic rainbows and prisms! There were mountains that looked to my
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: amazed eyes as lofty as Mont Blanc, and as massive, every solid mile of
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: which was composed of crystalline ice, refracting and reflecting the
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: sunbeams with iridescent splendor. For now we could begin to see a part
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: of the orb of the sun itself, prodigious in size, and poised on the edge
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: of the gem-glittering horizon, where the jeweled summits split its beams
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: into a thousand haloes.
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: There was one mighty peak, still ahead of us, but toward which we were
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: rushed sidewise by the wind, which surpassed all the others in
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: marvelousness. It towered majestically above our level--a superb,
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: stupendous, coruscating _Alp of Light_! On every side it darted blinding
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: rays of a hundred splendid hues, as if a worldful of emeralds, rubies,
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: sapphires, and diamonds had been heaped together in one gigantic pile and
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: transfused with a sunburst. Even Edmund was for a moment speechless with
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: astonishment at this wildly magnificent sight. But presently he spoke,
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: very calmly, though what he said changed our amazement to terror.
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: glittering devil no power under heaven can save us."
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: If my hair had not whitened before it surely would have whitened now!
title: A Columbus of Space

text: unexpectedly, out of a concealing cloud, and anticipation was swallowed

author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: up in the event. But now we had to bear the fearful strain of
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

title: A Columbus of Space

text: could aid us in the least. I thought that even Edmund's face paled with
title: A Columbus of Space

text: fear.

title: A Columbus of Space

title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

title: A Columbus of Space

author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

title: A Columbus of Space
