text: Our hearts beat more steadily again, but there was a greater danger, of
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: which he had warned us, but which we had not had time to contemplate. I,
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: at least, began to think of it with dismay when the scintillant peak was
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: left behind, and I saw Edmund again working away at his machinery.
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: Presently it was manifest that we were rapidly sinking.
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: "What's the matter?" I cried. "We seem to be going down."
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: "So we are," he replied quietly, "and I fear that we shall not go up
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: again very soon. The power is failing all the time. It will be pretty
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: hard to have to stop indefinitely in this frightful place, but I am
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: afraid that that is our destiny."
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: Lost and helpless in these mountains of ice and this world of gloom and
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: storm! The thought was too terrible to be entertained. Yet it was forced
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: into our minds even more by our leader's manner than by his words. Not
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: one of us failed to comprehend its meaning, and it was characteristic
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: that, while talkative Jack now said not a word, uncommunicative Henry
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: burst into a brief fury of denunciation. I was startled by the energy of
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: his words:
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: "Edmund Stonewall," he cried, agitating his arms, "you have brought me to
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: my death with your infernal invention! May you be--"
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: But he never finished the sentence. His face turned as white as a sheet,
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: and he sank in a heap upon the floor.
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: "Poor fellow," said Edmund, pityingly. "Would to God that he instead of
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: Church had remained at home. But I'll get him and all of us out of this
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: trouble; only give me a little time."
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: In a few minutes Jack and I had restored Henry to his senses, but he was
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: as weak as a child, and remained lying on one of the cushioned benches.
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: In the meantime the car descended until at last it rested upon the snow
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: in a deep valley, where we were protected from the wind. In this profound
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: depression a kind of twilight prevailed, for the sun, which we had
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: glimpsed when we were on the level of the peaks, was at least thirty
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: degrees below our present horizon. Henry having recovered his nerve, we
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: all got out of the car, unloosed the natives, and began to look about us.
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: The scene was more disheartening than ever. All about towered the crystal
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: mountains, their bases leaden-hued and formless in the ghostly gloom,
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: while their middle parts showed deep gleams of ultramarine, brightening
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: to purple higher up, and a few aspiring peaks behind us sparkled
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: brilliantly where the sunlight touched them. It was such a spectacle as
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: the imagination could not have conceived, and I have often tried in vain
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: to reproduce it satisfactorily in my own mind.
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: Was there ever such a situation as ours? Cast away in a place wild and
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: wonderful beyond description, millions of miles from all human aid and
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: sympathy, millions of miles from the world that had given us birth! I
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: could, in bitterness of spirit, have laughed at the suggestion that there
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: was any hope for us. And yet, at that very moment, not only was there
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: hope, but there was even the certainty of deliverance. But, unknown to
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: us, it lay in the brain of the incomparable man who had brought us
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: hither.
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: I have told you that it was twilight in the valley where we lay. But
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: when, as frequently happened, tempests of snow burst over the mountains,
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: and choked the air about us, the twilight turned to deepest night, and we
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: had to illumine the lamps in the car. By great good fortune, Edmund said,
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: enough power remained to furnish us with light and heat, and now I looked
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: upon those mysterious black-tusked muzzles in the car with a new
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: sentiment, praying that they would not turn to mouths of death.
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: The natives, being used to darkness, needed no artificial illumination.
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: In fact, we had observed that whenever the sunlight had streamed over
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: them their great eyes were almost blinded, and they suffered cruelly from
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: an affliction so completely outside of all their experience. Edmund now
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: began to speak to us of this, saying that he ought to have foreseen and
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: provided against it.
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: "I shall try to find some means of affording protection to their eyes
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: when we arrive in the sunlit hemisphere," he said. "It must be my first
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: duty."
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: We heard these words with a thrill of hope.
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: "Then you think that we shall escape?" I asked.
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: "Of course we shall escape," he replied cheerfully. "I give you my word
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: for it, but do not ask me for any particulars yet. The exact means I have
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: not yet found, but find them I will. We may have to stay where we are for
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: a considerable time, and our companions must be made comfortable. Even
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: under their furry skins they'll suffer from this kind of weather."
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: Following his directions we took a lot of extra furs from the car, and
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: constructed a kind of tent, under which the natives could huddle on the
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: sleds. There being but little wind in the valley, this was not so
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: difficult an undertaking as it may seem. And the poor fellows were very
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: glad of the shelter, for some of them were shivering, since, not knowing
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: what to do, they were less active than ourselves. No sooner were they
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: housed than they fell to eating ravenously. Both the car and the sleds
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: had been abundantly provisioned, so that there was no immediate fear of a
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: famine among us.
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: Inside the car we soon had things organized very much as they were during
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: our voyage from the earth. We read, talked, and smoked to our hearts'
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: content, almost forgetting the icy mountains that tottered over us, and
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: the howling tempest which, with hardly an intermission, tore through the
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: cloud-choked air a thousand or two thousand feet above our heads. We
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: talked of our adventure with the meteors, which seemed an event of long
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: ago, and then we talked of home--home twenty-six million miles away! In
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: fact, it may have been thirty millions by this time, for Edmund had told
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: us that Venus, having passed conjunction while we were at the caverns,
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: was now receding from the earth.
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: But while we thus strove to kill the time and banish thoughts of our
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: actual situation, Edmund sat apart much of the time absorbed in thought,
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: and we respected his privacy, knowing that our only chance of escape lay
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: in him. One day (I speak always of "days," because we religiously counted
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: the passage of time by our clock) he issued alone from the car and was
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: absent a long time, so that we began to be concerned, and, going outside
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: looked everywhere for signs of him. At length, to our infinite relief, he
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: appeared stumbling and crawling along the foot of an icy mountain. As he
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: drew nearer we saw that he was smiling, and as soon as he was within easy
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: earshot he called out:
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: "It's all right. I've found the solution."
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: Then upon joining us he continued:
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: "We'll get out all right, but we shall have to be patient for a while
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: longer."
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: "What is it?" we asked eagerly. "What have you found out?"
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: "Peter," he said, turning to me, "you know what libration means; well,
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: it's libration that is going to save us. As Venus travels round the sun
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: she turns just once on her axis in making a complete circuit, the
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: consequence being, as you already know, that she has one side on which
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: the sun never rises while the other half is in perpetual daylight. But,
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: since her orbit is not a perfect circle, she travels a little faster than
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: the average during about half of her year and a little slower during the
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: other half, but, at the same time, her steady rotation on her axis never
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: varies. This produces the phenomenon that is called libration, the result
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: of which is that, along the border between the day and night hemispheres
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: there is a narrow strip where the sun rises and sets once in each of her
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: years, which are about two hundred and twenty-five of our days in length.
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: Within this strip the sun shines continuously for about sixteen weeks,
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: gradually rising during eight weeks and sinking during the following
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: eight. Then, during the next sixteen weeks, the strip lies in unceasing
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: night.
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: "Now the kind fates have willed that we should fall just within this
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: lucky strip. By the utmost good fortune after we passed the blazing peak
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: which so nearly wrecked us, we were carried on by the wind so far, before
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: the ascensional power of the car gave out, that we descended on the
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: sunward side of the crest of the range. The sun is now just beginning to
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: rise on the part of the strip where we are, and it will get higher for
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: several weeks to come. The result will be that a great melting of ice and
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: snow will occur here, and in this deep valley a river will form, flowing
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: off toward the sunward hemisphere, exactly where we want to go. I shall
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: take advantage of the torrent that will flow here and float down with it
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: until we are out of the labyrinth. It's our only chance, for we couldn't
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: possibly clamber over the hummocky ice and drag the car with us."
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: "Why not leave the car here?" asked Henry.
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: Edmund looked at him and smiled.
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: "Do you want to stay on Venus all your life?" he asked. "I thought you
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: didn't like it well enough for that. How could we ever get back to the
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: earth without the car? I can repair the mechanism as soon as I can find
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: certain substances, which I am sure exist on this planet as well as on
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: the earth. But it is no use looking for them in this icy wilderness. No,
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: we can never abandon the car. We must take it with us, and the only
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: possible way to transport it is with the aid of the coming river."
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: "But how will you manage to float?" I asked.
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: "The car, being air-tight, will float like a buoy."
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: "But the natives, will you abandon them?"
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: "God forbid. I'll contrive a way for them."
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: The effects of libration on Venus were not new to me, but they were to
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: Jack and Henry, who had never studied such things, and they expressed
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: much doubt about Edmund's plan, but I had confidence in it from the
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: beginning, and it turned out just as he had predicted, as things always
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: did. Every twenty-four hours we saw, with thankful hearts, that the sun
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: had perceptibly risen, and as it rose, the sky gradually cleared, while
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: the sunbeams, falling uninterruptedly, grew hotter and hotter. Soon we no
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: longer had any use for furs, or for artificial heat. At the same time the
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: melting of the ice began. It formed, in fact, a new danger, by bringing
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: down avalanches into the valley, yet we watched the process joyously,
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: since it fell so entirely within Edmund's program. While we were awaiting
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: the flood, Edmund had prepared screens to protect the eyes of the
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: natives.

title: A Columbus of Space

title: A Columbus of Space

title: A Columbus of Space

title: A Columbus of Space

title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

title: A Columbus of Space

title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

title: A Columbus of Space

title: A Columbus of Space

title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

title: A Columbus of Space

author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

title: A Columbus of Space

text: BEFORE THE THRONE OF VENUS

title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: besetting us.
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: "You, of course, noted," he said, "how close we approached at one time to
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: may possibly be decisive in the determination of our fate."
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: "Favorable or unfavorable?" I asked.
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: "Unfavorable, for this reason. If these people could be made to
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: understand that we are visitors from another world, and not inhabitants
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: consideration, and even with a certain superstitious deference. The
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: and if you can once touch the imagination, even of the most intelligent
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: and instructed persons, you can do almost anything you choose with them.
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: But how am I to convey to them any idea of this kind? Seeing neither sun,
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: nor moon, nor stars, they can have no conception of such a thing as
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: another world than their own."
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

title: A Columbus of Space

title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

title: A Columbus of Space

title: A Columbus of Space

author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: Seized with curiosity, I pressed the magic box to my ear, and faintly
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: there echoed in my brain a few disconnected strains of that solemn music.
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: But now, more than ever, it was insufferable to me, and I dropped the box
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: with a crash.
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: As Edmund recovered his strength he once more took charge of the car, and
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: in a little while he had risen to a great height in order to take
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: advantage of the easier going in the lighter atmosphere above. Thus we
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: ran on for several hours until we began to catch sight of the sea, which
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: was soon beneath us, while far ahead we saw the tumbling clouds marking
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: the location of the belt of tempests behind which we knew lay the range
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: of the crystal mountains. At length we issued from beneath the cloud
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: dome, and then we saw the sun again, and the storms whipping the waters,
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: whose waves occasionally flashed up at us through rifts in the streaming
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: clouds beneath. And at last the icy peaks began to glitter on the
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: horizon, and we knew that we were nearing the world of eternal night and
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: frost. It was with strange feelings that we once more beheld the crystal
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: mountains, for our minds were filled with the recollection of the scenes
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: that had occurred among them when we were helpless in the grasp of their
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: tempests. But now there was a certain exhilaration in the thought that
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: this time we could safely sail over their summits. As we passed over them
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: we looked eagerly for landmarks that might show where our former passage
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: had occurred, and as Edmund purposely dropped as close to their summits
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: as it was safe to go, I at last believed that I recognized the mighty
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: peak of rainbows that had so nearly wrecked us.
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: When we had left the mountains behind and entered into the region of
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: night, I asked Edmund how he would proceed in order to find the location
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: of the caverns.
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: "I shall go by the stars," he said. "I noted the bearing of the place,
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: and I have no doubt that I can find it again."

text: CHAPTER XXI
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: THE EARTH
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: Edmund's reference to the stars instantly drew my attention to the
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: heavens. They were ablaze with amazing gems, but at first I could not see
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: the earth among them.
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: "I know what you are looking for," said Edmund. "Here, look through the
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: peephole in the bow. From our present position the earth appears but
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: little elevated above the horizon, but when we reach the caverns, which
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: are in the center of the dark hemisphere, we shall see her overhead."
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: I knelt at the peephole, and my heart was in my throat. There was our
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: glorious planet, oh, so bright! and close beside her the moon. At the
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: sight, an irrepressible longing arose in me to be once more at home. Jack
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: and Henry took their turns at looking, and they were no less affected
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: than I had been. But Edmund retained a perfect self-command:
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: "Do you know," he asked with an odd smile (for now the lamps were
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: glowing, and we had plenty of light in the car), "how long we have been
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: absent from home?"
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: Not one of us had kept a record.
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: "It is just six hundred and four days," he continued, "since we left New
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: York. We were sixteen days on our way to Venus; six days after our
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: arrival at the caverns occurred the conjunction of the earth, and the
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: ceremonies that Peter will not forget as long as he refrains from hair
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: dye; two days later we departed for the sun lands; and since then five
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: hundred and eighty days have passed. Now, between one conjunction of the
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: earth and Venus to the next, five hundred and eighty-four days elapse.
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: Already five hundred and eighty-two of those days have passed, so that
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: within two days another conjunction will occur, and if we are then at the
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: caverns we shall doubtless witness another sacrifice to the earth and the
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: moon."
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: "God forbid!" I exclaimed.
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: "I feel as you do," said Edmund. "We have seen enough of such things. In
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: order, then, to hasten our arrival at the caverns, where we must bury
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: Juba, for on that I insist, I am going to rise up out of the atmosphere,
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: in order that we may fly with planetary speed. We can thus reach the
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: caverns, traversing the five thousand miles of distance that yet remain,
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: in something like an hour, for some time must be lost in rising out of
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: and returning into the atmosphere, and in the meantime I must make
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: observations to determine our location. Having found the caverns we will
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: complete our rites at Juba's grave, and get away for good before the
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: sacrificial ceremonies begin."
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: It was a programme that suited us all, and it was quickly carried out. I
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: had not thought that my admiration of Edmund's ability could be
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: increased, but it was carried a notch higher when I saw how easily,
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: guiding himself by the ever-visible stars, he located the caverns. When
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: he knew that he was directly over them he dropped the car swiftly, and we
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: could not repress a cry as we saw directly beneath us the familiar shafts
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: of light issuing from the ground.
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: "We may have to do a little searching," said Edmund, as we approached the
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: lights, "for, of course, my observations are not accurate enough to
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: enable me to locate the exact spot where we landed before."
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: But fortune favored us marvelously, and the very first opening that we
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: approached was at once recognized, for there stood the sacrificial altar.
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: We anchored the car near the shaft, and carried out Juba's coffin.
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: "Wait here," said Edmund, "while I descend."
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: "No, you're not going alone," exclaimed Jack. "I'll go with you."
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: Edmund made no objection and he and Jack descended the steps. Half an
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: hour elapsed before they returned, accompanied by a dozen of the natives,
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: stolid, and not exhibiting the signs of surprise over our return which I
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: had expected to see. Edmund had now made so much progress in their
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: strange means of communication that he had little difficulty in causing
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: them to comprehend what was wanted. They easily carried the coffin, and
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: all of us followed down into the depths. It was the strangest funeral
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: procession that ever a man saw!
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: While the grave was being prepared in the underground cemetery where we
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: had witnessed the interment of the first victim of our pistols, Henry and
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: I remained as a sort of guard of honor for Juba in the lower of the two
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: great chambers which have been described in the earlier chapters of this
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: history, and there a most singular thing occurred. We were startled by a
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: low whining, and looking about saw one of the doglike creatures which
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: appeared to be the only inhabitants of the caverns except the natives
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: seated on its haunches close to the coffin, and exhibiting exactly the
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: signs of distress that a dog sometimes displays over its dead master.
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: That we were taken aback by this scene I need not assure you. We had
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: never observed, during our former visit, that either Juba or any of his
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: people was followed by these creatures; in fact, they had always fled at
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: our approach, and we had paid little attention to them.
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: But now, if the poor animal could have spoken, he could not more plainly
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: have told us that, by means of the mysterious instinct which beings of
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: his kind possess, he had recognized the presence of his old master, and
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: was mourning for him. It was truly a touching spectacle, and Henry was
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: hardly less moved by it than I. When Edmund and Jack came back, having
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: superintended the preparations, Jack was cut to the heart by the sight.
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: Immediately he declared that the "dog" must accompany us in the car, and
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: Edmund assented by a grave inclination of the head. The animal followed
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: us to the grave, and remained there watching us intently. He seemed to
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: have dismissed his fear, as if he comprehended that we were friends of
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: his master.
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: There were not more than twenty of the natives present at the interment,
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: and none of them showed signs of sorrow. And when the grave was closed
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: and we turned away, the little creature followed at our heels. Edmund had
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: carved on a flat stone the word "JUBA," and left it lying on the grave,
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: and Jack, having nothing else, threw a silver dollar on top of it. The
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: natives probably regarded these things as talismans, or religious
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: symbols, for they treated them with the greatest deference, and no doubt
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: they lie there yet, and will continue to lie there through all the eons,
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: for in those dry caverns the progress of decay can hardly be perceptible
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: even after the passage of ages. It was a singular fact, noted by Edmund,
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: that the natives exhibited not the slightest curiosity concerning their
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: comrades who had been lost in the crystal mountains, and I really doubt
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: whether they knew what the coffin contained.
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: When we had paid the last honors to Juba, we began to think of our final
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: departure. This place had become disagreeable to us. After the brilliant
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: scenes that we had witnessed on the other side of the planet, the gloom
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: here, and the absence of all that had made the land of perpetual daylight
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: seem a paradise of beauty, were intensely oppressive to our spirits. But
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: Edmund still wished to make some investigations, and we were compelled to
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: await his movements. What the nature of his investigations was I do not
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: know, for I was devoured by the desire to get away, and did not inquire.
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: But fully twenty-four hours had elapsed before our leader was ready to
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: depart. In the meanwhile "Juba's dog" had become firmly attached to Jack,
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: who petted it as probably no creature of its race had ever been petted
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: before. It was a strange-looking animal; about as large as a terrier,
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: with a big square head, covered with long black hair, while, in startling
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: imitation of the hirsute adornment of the natives themselves, its body
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: was clothed with a golden-white pelt of silky texture. It would eat
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: anything we offered it, and seemed immensely pleased with its new master,
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: as it had every reason for being.
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: During the last hours of our stay we noticed unmistakable indications of
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: preparation for the dreaded ceremonies of the conjunction, and our
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: departure was hastened on that account. The priests, whom Edmund had been
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: compelled to put out of the way of further mischief on the former
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: occasion, had been replaced by others, and we thought that, perhaps, this
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: being the first opportunity for the display of their functions, they
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: would try to make it memorable--which presented a still stronger reason
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: why we should not delay. But, with one thing and another, we were held
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: back until the very eve of the ceremonies.
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: When we finally stood ready to enter the car, with Juba's dog at Jack's
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: heels, the procession up the steps had already begun. Edmund decided to
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: wait until the multitude had all assembled. They came trooping up into
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: the starlight, and I am sure that they had no idea of what we intended to
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: do. Undoubtedly they must have recalled what had happened on the other
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: occasion, but they showed no sign of either regret or anxiety on that
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: account. They arranged themselves in a dense circle, as before, and the
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: priests took their place in the center. At this moment Edmund gave the
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: word to enter the car. We sprang into it, and immediately Jack and I went
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: out on a window ledge in order to get a better view of the scene. Edmund
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: started the car, and we rose straight toward the earth which glowed in
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: the zenith. Our movement was unexpected, and we at once arrested the
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: attention even of the priests. The beginning of the ceremony was stopped
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: short. All eyes were evidently drawn to us, and when they saw the
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: direction that we were taking a low murmur arose.
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: "Let me give them a parting salute," said Jack.
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: Edmund thought a moment, and then said:
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: "Very well, take a gun, but don't fire at them. If it terrifies them into
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: abandoning their sacrifice we shall have done one good thing in this
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: world."
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: Jack instantly had the gun roaring, and although we were now high above
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: their heads, we could see that they were seized with consternation,
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: rising from their knees, and running wildly about. Whether the noise and
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: the sight of us flying toward the earth, had the effect which Edmund had
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: hoped for, will never be known; but the last sight we had of living
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: beings on Venus was the spectacle of those white forms darting about in
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: the starry gloom.
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: Our long journey home was interrupted by one more almost tragic episode.
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: When we had been ten days in flight, and the earth had become like a
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: round moon of dazzling brilliance, Juba's dog, which had grown feeble and
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: refused to eat, died. Jack was broken-hearted, and protested when Edmund
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: said that the body of the animal must be thrown out. He would have liked
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: to try to stuff the skin, but Edmund was firm.
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: "But if you open a window," I said, "the air will escape."
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: "Some of it will undoubtedly escape," Edmund replied. "But, luckily, this
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: is the air of Venus which we are carrying, and being very dense, we can
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: spare a little of it without serious results. I shall be quick, and there
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: will be no danger."
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: It was as he had said. When the window was partially opened, for only a
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: second or two, we distinctly felt a lowering of the atmospheric pressure
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: that made us gasp for a moment, but instantly Edmund had the window
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: closed again, and we were all right. As we shot away we saw the little
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: "It is a new planet born," said Edmund, "and the law of gravitation will
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: pay it as much attention as if it were a Jupiter. It may wander in space
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: for untold ages, and sometime it may even fall within the sphere of the
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: will be but a flying spark, flashing momentarily in the heavens as it
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: shoots through the air."
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: not wish to take the car to New York. He landed in the midst of the
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: Adirondack woods, far from any habitation, and there, concealed in a
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: visit a barber and a clothing merchant. Probably, as we carried some of
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: the guns, they took us for a party of hunters who wished to furbish up
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: before revisiting civilization.
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: On reaching New York, we went, in the evening, straight to the Olympus
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: Club, where our arrival caused a sensation. We found Church in the old
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: corner, staring dejectedly at a newspaper. He did not see who was
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: approaching him. Jack slapped him on the shoulder, and as he looked up
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: and recognized us he fell back nearly fainting, and with mouth open,
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: unable to utter a word.
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: "Come, old man," said Jack, "so we've found you! What did you run away
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: for? Let me introduce you to the Columbus of Space, and don't you forget
title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: that I'm one of his lieutenants."
title: A Columbus of Space

title: A Columbus of Space
author: Serviss, Garrett Putman

text: to this day, that we lost our "balloon," as he calls it, and invented the
